e4: Adopting an unbiased financial reporting policy enhances corporate integrity and compliance with regulatory standards, potentially avoiding legal issues. It fosters transparency, which is crucial for maintaining investor trust and confidence over the long term. Although there may be short-term market adjustments due to the change in reporting practice, the long-term benefits of aligning with ethical practices and reducing the information asymmetry between sophisticated and retail investors outweigh the initial challenges.
e5: An ethical reporting policy should prioritize accuracy, transparency, and fairness, ensuring all stakeholders receive the same information without bias or manipulation. It should comply with all relevant legal standards and accounting norms. Additionally, critical to its ethical standing would be its consistency in application and its provision for equal accessibility to information so that all investors, regardless of their level of sophistication, have the opportunity to make informed decisions based on the true financial health of the company.
e6: Yes, I would ask how management plans to communicate the policy change clearly to all investors to mitigate any potential misunderstandings. Additionally, what strategies are in place to handle the short-term market reactions that might arise from this change in earnings reporting? Lastly, how will the company ensure ongoing compliance and monitor the effectiveness of the new policy?
